item.title: Why do they call it the Xbox 360?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

uh, look at hackers on f2p games compared to p2p subscription games

And xbox is more risky to hack on than pc. pc you get banned from the game, xbox you get completely banned on all games because youre banned from live

Read full topic

That has stopped people from hacking since the beginning of… Never.

item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:30, topic:427488”][quote author=Frell link=topic=530186.msg3874474#msg3874474 date=1325561602]
very little hackers
[/quote]so i herd u live in unicornland[/quote]

[quote=“tL, post:31, topic:427488”][quote author=Frell link=topic=530186.msg3874474#msg3874474 date=1325561602]
Because its kept really neat and tidy honestly, you get dlc early, very little hackers, never any downtime
[/quote]

I dunno about “very little hackers”. I know so many people, who are idiots, modding their console to cheat online. If technical retards like that are doing it, I imagine many more are too.[/quote]

was talking about the xbox alone

Read full topic
item.source: Why do they call it the Xbox 360?

item.title: Why do they call it the Xbox 360?
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

Matchmaking is a cunt (on PC at least).

Recent example: Space Marine
Every Mp game I joined of that, I was thrown on to some faggot host in a bumfuck town on the other side of the world. Every single person in the game would have 1000+ ping, and the host is running around at local pings. It would only ever change host when that host left, and even then it was most likely to pick some other faggot in middle-of-bumfuck, causing 2 people to get good pings, and the rest to be 500+.

Stopped playing that game for that sole reason.

If it had a server browser, doesn’t even need to be dedicated servers, just domething to let me manually choose my best server, then I’d still be playing.

I’ve found it the same for most PC games with matchmaking.

Read full topic
item.source: Why do they call it the Xbox 360?

item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Frell:

picks a good ping

nope

Frell:

decently populated server for you…

nope

matchmaking is usually slow and clunky and there’s something to be said when you can pick a decent game and join manually faster than a computer picking automatically

Read full topic
item.source: Why do they call it the Xbox 360?

item.title: Why do they call it the Xbox 360?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Frell:

whats wrong with matchmaking though? picks a good ping, decently populated server for you…

Nothing, I don’t think I ever said anything was wrong with matchmaking. I was arguing that consoles are easier to get online with because of the fact it’s almost a requirement for console online games to have matchmaking.

It isn’t perfect though, dedicated servers + a server list allows people to go back to their same servers over and over again, with the same people, not having to mess around with party systems. Peer to peer matches + matchmaking destroys that ability to create a consistent community.

Read full topic
item.source: Why do they call it the Xbox 360?

item.source: Why do they call it the Xbox 360?

item.title: Why do they call it the Xbox 360?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:17, topic:427488”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=530186.msg3872356#msg3872356 date=1325442857]
Personally I don’t mind consoles, I just find it much more convenient to play on a computer. That and it’s a lot harder to play ‘online’ with consoles (yes I know you can, it’s just not as easy), and I hate most single player games. I need the interaction.
[/quote]

How isn’t it as easy? It’s pretty much a requirement for most console games that they at least have a matchmaking service, just press “Quick match” and you’re in a game pretty quickly.

More PC games have dedicated servers and sometimes you’ll have to hunt around different servers for the settings you want, and if they’re user controlled dedicated servers then it can be even harder to find the type of game you want. That is also a great thing about PC online gaming, but I don’t think I’d say it was easier than console online gaming, but overall it is better as it’s more flexible.[/quote]It’s not in-game I meant, and either way it’s nothing big, but you know, signing up for whatever service it is, in xbox’s case paying for live, then getting your console to connect to your internet etc. I already have most of those things done, I just tend to not like the games as much.

Read full topic
item.source: Why do they call it the Xbox 360?

item.title: Why do they call it the Xbox 360?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Davidi2:

Personally I don’t mind consoles, I just find it much more convenient to play on a computer. That and it’s a lot harder to play ‘online’ with consoles (yes I know you can, it’s just not as easy), and I hate most single player games. I need the interaction.

How isn’t it as easy? It’s pretty much a requirement for most console games that they at least have a matchmaking service, just press “Quick match” and you’re in a game pretty quickly.

More PC games have dedicated servers and sometimes you’ll have to hunt around different servers for the settings you want, and if they’re user controlled dedicated servers then it can be even harder to find the type of game you want. That is also a great thing about PC online gaming, but I don’t think I’d say it was easier than console online gaming, but overall it is better as it’s more flexible.

Read full topic
item.source: Why do they call it the Xbox 360?
